website_summaries.verdict: Popular bike rack at an affordable price. Split consumer opinion on how sturdy it is.
pros: Can easily accommodate a tandem bike
cons: Wing nuts sometimes come loose via vibration
Lower weight limit, more assembly required than some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for highway driving.
customer_reviews.text: I assembled. Instructions are extremely small print. Put it in my car and it’s very wobbly. I purchased based on reviews but the reviews are wrong. I have attached a video. I do not believe this is save. It wobbles even with my bike on it. I think it would be okay to drive slow on residential streets. I need one for the freeway and there is no way I would drive with this on May car in a Freeway
customer_reviews.author: Good Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Received my Swagman bike carrier a few days ago and already used it twice, I couldn't be happier! I don't even need my husband's help I'm a senior in my late sixties! It's well build and super easy to put together, load the bikes and in and out of the hitch. Bikes are held firmly and will travel securely without any bounce at all! Happy camper, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Bikes fall off
customer_reviews.text: After using this for some time, we have lost a bike on the road and almost just lost another one recently. I like this bike rack because it's small and easy to take on and off the car. But I have to give it 1 star because losing bikes on the road is not safe. The hooks that hold the bikes down are coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: C. Piccoli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent carrier with best Value Possible.
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality bike carrier, easy to assemble and install on vehicle, and holds bikes very firmly while traveling. I am a mechanical engineer and recognize solid construction and quality merchandise when I see it - This Swagman bike carrier is excellent and comes highly recommended by me. Viewed negative comments and cannot agree. When properly assembled and easily installed, it is a very strong and solid carrier.
customer_reviews.author: GarGold

customer_reviews.title: unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I noticed one of the hooks you use to secure the bicycles is not fully assembled, and the parts for the release button are nowhere to be found. Great.... Just great...
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Bradway

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use with expensive bikes
customer_reviews.text: During a 4 hour road trip, I watched my Specialized Rockhopper 29er bounce out of the wheel trays and fell out tumbling onto the highway. The front wheel is bent, hand grips and seat are shredded. The saving grace was the saddlebag frame took some of the damage, which may have saved the frame. The hooks were firmly locked (suspension compressed), and were still in the same position. The wheels purely bounced out of the trays. This occurred on a flat highway, about 1/4 mi. after a sharp turn going about 45mph. Roads were normal NY roads, nothing rough yet. Tie down the wheels!
customer_reviews.author: N+B

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: We just lost a $1000 mountain bike on I65 in Nashville, TN. I recommend strapping your bicycle on ad we had just checked it 20-30 miles back and it was down and locked. Not a happy camper right now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Beeman

customer_reviews.title: Wont carry 2 Specialized Mens Rockhoppers
customer_reviews.text: Unless i am an idiot, which is possible, the way it clamps the bikes down wont work with 2 mens bikes with the same frame due to there only being one pole for the clamps to come down on. They are not able to be the same height and i dont want one down on my sprocket, so returning. Would be GREAT for a mens and womens, or even just one, because it is rock solid and tight, but it just wont work for my configuration. yes, my wife rides a boys bike!
customer_reviews.author: B. E.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use. Bike can/will fall off.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this rack. My local bike shop used to sell them. The shop quit selling them because bikes kept falling off and the shop had to repair/replace them. My bike fell off. I know. Then there's that big bar in the middle. You have to lift your bike over it or slip it between the bar and the vehicle to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple lightweight rack for transporting my bike. One downside not the fault of the rack but my bike the Trek 7.2fx is when you lower the lock bar down on the frame it directly contacts the 3 frame cables that control rear brakes and the gears. Without a small cloth or pad slipped in between the cables and bike frame it can scratch in transport. If your cables are under frame no issue at all. A simple piece of cloth does the trick. But as far a# loading, securing and transporting bike it’s as simple as can be.
customer_reviews.author: t_kouyeas

customer_reviews.title: Too much play in this design.
customer_reviews.text: Good news: raxk was well packed, perfectly powdercoated, made by Canadidans. Bad news: our 2011 Rav4 with spare tire on back door did accommodate the rack but it swayed too much when the bikes were attached to it. I know I could have attached a bunch of bungies to hogtie it and keep it from coming apart. But it's heavy, doesn't allow the back door to open easily when attached and just seemed unnecessarily complex compared to the high quality rack that attaches to the spare itself instead of the trailer hitch.
customer_reviews.author: G. Payne

customer_reviews.title: WOW  What an improvement
customer_reviews.text: I had the original one....no comparison... PROS easy common sense assemble.. solid ..no movement in the receiver...whatsoever... The older model did not have the rachet hooks...WHAT AN AWESOME IMPROVEMENT Nice paint job..I ride about 100 miles a week..I'm 65 this is a sweet bike rack.. VERY PLEASED!!!!!!!!!!!! CONS..with the older one I could leave the bike rack on and attach my jon boat trailer as well...with this one the receiver needs to be removed on every fishing trip..takes 5 minutes max. Fact I love the threaded bolt/pin..doubly secure.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck 7

customer_reviews.title: Great - just be cautious of the middle handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike rack! Holds our 2 bikes wonderfully and is easy to use for transportation! We are glad we bought this style! Cons: 1) One of the holes that the pin inserts into is a little hard to get in - have the adjust the foot base to get it in properly. That probably is just our own manufacturer issue, but isn't that difficult. 2) The middle arm/handle that holds down the bike does leave a small mark on our bikes. It hasn't rubbed off the paint but I will probably have a small piece of cloth on that area to prevent damage to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this rack at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: Phew, no more fumblin and bumblin with taking on and off the front wheel to transport my bike! The rack was very easy to assemble. I cheated though because I'm an auto mechanic. I used my impact gun to tighten the bolt through the hitch. When the bikes are mounted and you shake the bike and only the car moves. I use an old school U-lock around the frame to the center pole when I run into a store but I wouldn't lock it over night like that. Enjoy your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Bike Rack. comes with threaded hitch pin. USE IT
customer_reviews.text: Update: its been a few years and this rack is still going strong! No major rust anywhere. This is the best bang for your buck on any bike mount out there!!!! this is a great rack for bicycles. One major thing i would like to point out, If you use the threaded hitch pin as suggested the rack is very secure. but if you use a normal hitch pin then it will wobble all over the place. it comes with a threaded pin and you dont need anything except your hitch to hook it up. I bought two of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Too much sway with my hitch
customer_reviews.text: I really like the concept of this rack, but it makes me too nervous when it's on. The original hitch pin/screw was not long enough to fit through my hitch. Therefore, when a bike was placed on rack, there was quite a bit of sway. I ended finding a longer pin that fits through the main post and an additional plate, that pulls the rack up tight against the hitch. This has reduced the sway within the hitch, but not to the point where I feel very comfortable traveling at 70 MPH, or even turning. While a great value for the price, I just wish the rack sat tighter within the hitch itself (2020 Toyota Tacoma)
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good rack - but invites theft
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping they'd put a welded loop ring (to run a cable through) or something on this rack to improve security. As it is, the holes in the main part are big enough to attach a small padlock and you can hook a small cable to that - but it is cumbersome and sloppy. Also, someone could easily steal the other parts with no tools required. Basically, you can put a lock on the bike frame and attach it to the trailer hitch ring (which has nothing to do with the rack) to secure the bike but if you leave the rack itself (no bike) overnight, it is not really securable.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Rack! This bike rack works well for transporting two bicycles. The rack is easy to set-up and nice to handle. If you are looking for people to make comments like "nice rack" and "what a rack" then this is the rack for you! The item worked as expected and was easy to install and assemble but, beware, the instructions are horrible. They do not enumerate the different screw and washer types so you will be left to figure that out on your own. It is a good rack if you are always transporting the same two bikes but, if you were constantly changing bikes it would be a hassle to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas M.

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality and design
customer_reviews.text: Seems very solid. Easy enough to put two bikes on it. The vertical arm folds down so you can open the hatch on your car. Not as heavy as the Yakima version but I think it’s plenty strong. Update: had this for several months. I really like it once you figure out the order in which to load the two bikes. The wheel holders are adjustable for a secure fit for any bike. It's definitely solid.
customer_reviews.author: snorton

customer_reviews.title: Too much wiggle
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Swagman XC hitch. I purchased this for my new Kia Sorento. I particularly wanted less weight in the hitch when changing it. Getting older. What I don't like is the amount of wiggle with the two inch adapter. I have a new tow package put in by U-haul. I think it is secure but do not like the sway of the bike due to the 2 inch adapter not being snug enough.
customer_reviews.author: wpguro

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack, bad fit on hitch
customer_reviews.text: The hitch is not a good fit. The adapter to fit a 2” receiver is loose and allows the rack to wobble. That puts a lot of unnecessary wear and tear on the hitch. The rack sits crooked even without bikes loaded. I like everything else about the way the rack functions and looks. I’m going to try another sleeve so that it will fit snugly into a 2” receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria G

customer_reviews.title: For what it is and the cost, you cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Going from a roof rack on my previous vehicle to a Wrangler and a hitch rack, this was purchased as a pacifier. Ideally, I would like something more sturdy so I am holding out on a particular company in Wisconsin to produce their second generation of the best hitch rack ever made. This rack does everything it is supposed to do. It was easy to assemble, it folds down small enough to stay out of the way in my shed. I was pleasantly surprised and will probably continue to use this until it falls apart. I'm no longer in a hurry to drop $500 on something else that will ultimately do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my ebike only. Its states 2 bikes at 35lbs ea. so my ebike weighs 53lbs and has 700c tires. Was easy to assemble and install. I applied thread lock anywhere I felt it need or more. Will be carrying a ratchet with socket in my truck to remove hitch pin. Haven't driven far yet, has a little flex when traveling but I think that is expected from any platform carrier. I like the platform better feels really secure in rack. Purchased a bar attachment since this is a step thru for extra security. So far pleased with this but will update either way in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: returned, too many parts
customer_reviews.text: Was of solid steel, but need to screw in parts for all four wheel holders. Appeared that they will loosen as you drive and will have to be regularly adjusted. Instructions book warned to paraphrase: the bikes can and will come off, if ride over rough roads. I ride over plenty of rough roads as state I live in fails to do basic fixes of roads. I returned it without using it so can't be sure. But after looking at it decided to stay with system I have where bikes hang suspended from frames. Can securely lock frames to that type of bike carrier, this one I'm not sure about.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not approved for RVs
customer_reviews.text: I went to the trailer store where I bought the trailer (Little Guy Max) to see what bike rack they recommended. This one. Then I came here and bought it. I just unpacked it - it looks sturdy enough and like it will go together cleanly. But I note the big orange warning label - not approved for trailers or RVs. It's too heavy! So warranty is void if used. I note that it is 28 lbs and the trailer hitch supports 150lbs, so I should be ok. I'll come back and update the review in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M

customer_reviews.title: Sway when driving but it is secure and it's heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Good but not great bike carrier, it's made solid and it's heavy, has good tie down brackets and I like the part that it use a screw in bolt with a clip to secure the hitch to the receiver . Bad points it's universal connector and fits very losely into 2 in the receiver hitch,, which cause the rack to sway a little when driving.. Its hard to store, due to the bar on the receiver hitch is not removable. After 5 months of use and several trips hauling the bikes it has held up with no issues. If I had to do it over again I would buy a better lighter carrier. That is more compact to store.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rack because of the way the bikes were held in place. I have a 2019 Chevrolet Colorado that it's attached to. Very easy to assemble and fit in receiver hitch perfectly with little to no movement. Makes taking the bike off/on very easy compared to lifting the bike into the bed of the truck and laying it down.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this rack
customer_reviews.text: Not great for long transports- the arms will loosen up and let go of your bikes. I ended up having to use a ratchet strap in addition to hold the bikes securely on. Also pretty rusty after only 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Beaker Z

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack, Wobbles a little at times
customer_reviews.text: Pros Price Easy to Adjust Great for bikes without a crossbar Cons Not easy to load the back bike Wobbles on bumpy terrain This is a good bike rack especially for the price. I take my bike all over and it's easy to load and unload. Putting the second bike on is not as fun because it has to go between the car and the rack. Once the bikes are on they are secure and don't move or swing, but no matter how many times I have tightened to bolt at the hitch there is still wobble in the rack itself.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Breiten

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use even for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have an electric bike so it’s heavy. But this rack is low enough for me to place the front tire then lift the back into place. My only concern was the bike, once on the rack and secured, felt a little wobbly. But i purchased a few straps and it felt very secure. I am 58 and this is the first time ever using a bike rack. Pleasantly surprised how easy it is to use!
customer_reviews.author: Carol White

customer_reviews.title: Worst rack in the market
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not worth it. No doubt other racks are expensive. This rack does not secure your bike at all. It has enough flex so that your bike falls on the pavement even if you press the locking arm the harder you could. Lost my bike and I was not going to jam the brakes and get hit on the back. When I went around to get my bike it was run over and it was in pieces. Honestly, buy yourself a better one, it will save you a very sad time. Would not recomend this to anyone if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Diego

customer_reviews.title: Bikes fall off after less than a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why my bikes are falling off. If you have cheap bikes, this is ok to use... my $2000 full suspension bike will never see this rack EVER! I just use the back of my truck now. Would not buy this again. So, my wife's bike fell off of this rack into the middle of the road in traffic. Snapped her rear mech and broke her stem!!! It was as much to replace those parts as it was to buy this rack. Greatly dissatisfied with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Budget Bike Rack.
customer_reviews.text: Well build product, easy to out together and use. For the price this is the best budget bike rack, but it has a couple flaws. First of all the hitch couple is a little small and the rack swings a little while driving. Second if you have bike with a non traditional frame geometry (ie. Downhill, Enduro, etc.) you’ll need to strap down the wheels to the bottom support otherwise your bike will fly out. Unless you’re ready to spend 200-300 on a bike rack, this is the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 2016 Sienna - Does Not fit 2 Bikes - Would not order agian
customer_reviews.text: **** Update after using for several months. What do you expect for the price. Does not fit two bikes on a 2016 Sienna without additional products. Does not secure bikes without much force applied downward. (My wife just informed me that's she's putting the bike in the back of the van because she can't get it to mount her bike securely.) This is due to the mounts not being long enough for the clamps to mount in the lowest part of the frame. Does not release without an incredible amount of grip strength. Bends easily. Wheel hoops rattle loose.
customer_reviews.author: MJam

customer_reviews.title: Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. We use it on the back of our 2017 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Sahara. It rides good but sways side to side in the connection to the hitch extension. No play in the extension to hitch connection. We will be using a tie down strap to the outer bumper to stop the sway. Our spare tire is on the back of the jeep and has a cover over it. We are unable to carry a 2nd bike unless we remove the cover or the pedal from the bike. The extension would need to be about 2" longer on this application. Otherwise we like the bike rack. It is a good value and appears to be well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Renfro

customer_reviews.title: Securely transport your bikes.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and folds up for quick and space-saving storage. I've used it about 4 times so far, and it's held up well on freeways, bumpy roads and speed bumps. Get the swagman anti-wobble threaded hitch pin for security, since you're spending good money on it. Allows you to put a lock on the adjustable arm to also secure your bikes if you have to step away.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Rudy

customer_reviews.title: BEST OF ALL:Sticks out only 17 inches from my Jeep Compass hitch!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money! However, tie those tires down if you have a 29er bike or it will roll right out of the rack on sharp corners. Had to stop and pick my bike up once. That taught me to use a small bunji cord on the wheels to the wrack holder. The lower price make that well worth it. Also this model sticks out only 17 inches from my Jeep Compass and all ther others my friends have barely fit into the garage. They stick out a round 26 inches from the end of the hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. In Colorado

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For!
customer_reviews.text: I've had numerous problems with this bike carrier. I'm not going to write a lengthy review detailing every little thing I had issues with because I've already spent enough time researching how to fix the issues I had (not to mention the money I spent on the fixes as well). Suffice it to say that I wish I could return this product (I waited too long to use it and am outside my 30 day return window) and buy something of much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: jande016

customer_reviews.title: I am still using it and it is still working great. And I put HEAVY bikes on it
customer_reviews.text: This tough little rack is still going strong. I bought in 2010 and I leave it on the vehicle year round. It has weathered the abuse I heap on it very well. I am still using it and it is still working great. And I put HEAVY bikes on it. My bikes are electric and have a Lithium battery back which is very heavy. I would guess each bike is at least 50 to 65 lb. there is some surface rust now but considering the abuse I heap on it, it owe me nothing. Great rack worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E. Lay

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet arms mar frames!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed okay with the bike rack until we removed the bikes after traveling to our destination. On both brand new bikes, the ratchet arms that hold the bikes in place had worn off the paint where the arms meet the top tube!!! So much for their claim "New frame grip arms with improved soft frame-friendly coating to protect bike’s finish". The coating appears that it would be safe, but it in no way is. This is very disappointing. I imagine we will have to search for another bike carrier. We had one of the carriers that suspend the bike by the top tube and have never had a problem like this in 15 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2017 Tacomas
customer_reviews.text: The antiwobble bolt for this does not fully fit through my stock 2017 Tacoma hitch. Unable to insert the pin. The antiwobble was the sole reason for purchasing and it turns out it doesn't even fit. Was not expecting to have to make my own modifications for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Very good bike carrier
customer_reviews.text: Very good bike carrier. Pros: Adjustable for any bike. Vertical bar folds down for access to my truck bed. Well built and solid. Ratchet assembly is secure. Cons: There is some wobble at the hitch. You have to use the included hitch pin and it is bolted to the receiver. I wish it were a little tighter. I've used snake locks to secure the carrier and bikes to the safety bar next to the receiver and they work great. My bikes were secure traveling down the highway at 75.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyB

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use but unlocking the top clamp gets iffy sometimes. I lubed it but sometimes it does not easily release the bike. After a while, you learn a few tricks to make it easier but it is not a great design. Clamping the bike is easy though and takes 2 seconds to safely secure your bike. The hole for the optional padlock that you supply is drilled through thin sheet metal and barely has any metal around it. Looks like a pair of tin snips would cut the lock out and defeat it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: William Sattler

customer_reviews.title: I PAID for NEW rack and got one USED!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got my rack on Sunday. I was excited I till I open box (which you could tell was repackaged. Not only did it arrive USED but the price was reduced the moment I spent $164.54. It’s now listed for $105.30. The unit was clearly USED as pieces were already assembled and had scratches on them. Disappointed but hopefully it’ll work for transporting my bike this week.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Horn

customer_reviews.title: For the price you make few compromises!
customer_reviews.text: My bikes no longer interfere with each other like they did with my old one(the hanging veriety). the mount otherwise feels very sturdy. There aren't a bunch of hanging straps like some other models. I really like the simplicity of dropping my bike into the wheel rings, lower the hook down, done! If you have a hitch, this is the way to go. If I had to pick on something, it's that there is no way to open my trunk while bikes are on the rack. This teacher, however, costs around $400!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gt5228

customer_reviews.title: Wish it folded down.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Our bikes feel very secure. My only complaint is I can’t fold it down. I would like that because otherwise I’m unable to access my trunk without taking it off. We being a bike trailer with us, so that makes it really inconvenient to get in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. The rack holds my bike in place without excessive wobble. Easy to load and unload the bike. Rack is very solid and should last for years. Directions are poorly written but a simple search will take you to a U-tube video and shows you step by step. Took about 5 minutes to assemble and yes, it really is that simple. Would recommend this bike rack and cannot see any reason why people want to pay more for a bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution, Easy Use, Does Not Block Rear View
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution on SUV. Easy to load bikes, clamp downs hold securely and 6mm Master lock 2-pak is perfect for "security" as well as available optional locking bolt for hitch mount. Not a drawback as this is very sturdy as is, but wish was available with 2" hitch vs. the included adapter, though this makes it universally swappable to smaller autos and larger SUV. Should come with a set of thin stick-on reflector strips (auto parts store item trimmed narrower) for visibility at night. These still allow adjustment of hoops and clamp-downs.
customer_reviews.author: Rialbo

customer_reviews.title: Serious Garbage
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this rack for a few months. This rack WILL destroy the paint on your bike. I purchased a new bike for my fiancee and the bike tires were flat after putting the bike on the rack. Secondly, her new bike was scratched immediately. Our bikes get a flat tire every time we use this rack. It's extremely annoying to get to a bike trail and find our new tires are flat. The rack is extremely wobbly on the road and unsafe. I use a redundant strap on the frame just in case the rack fails. This particular rack is worth more in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I bought this bike rack that the tire sits in, instead of the type where the bikes hang on hooks. This rack seems more stable and secure, and you can slide and secure the rings on the bottom to fit different sizes bikes. I bought a locking bar to secure the rack to the hitch, to prevent rack from being stolen. Swagman sells the lock too. I would definitely make this purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Great hitch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this hitch a lot. The downsides? It touches my frame (which I knew) so I use a cloth to prevent any rubbing. I also wish the vertical arm folded so I could open my back door when the bike it not on the mount. I have a 4Runner and it all works great. I kinda wish I had spent some more to get a few more convenience features. I knew what I was buying but this is the first I have purchased. I like the others better where the adjustable arm grabs the tire instead of the frame. They do cost a whole lot more but have the features I'd really appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Julie F

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: The rack worked really well. It held the bike very secure. I ordered the lock that goes with it but it was delayed and I didn’t receive it in time before I left the address where it was sent. I will have to get it next time I am there.
customer_reviews.author: Guerry Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hitch-based bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new car and had a trailer hitch installed just for a bike rack. Swagman is great product at a great price. Pros: Keeps bikes very secured with very little effort. Folds up for easy in car storage between rides. Cons: Getting the rack into the hitch is awkward, especially getting the holes to line up for the cotter pin. It sticks out a couple of feet from the car, and blocks the rear door from lifting (hence the on/off for storage). But that said, it does the job quite well. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Reed

customer_reviews.title: I love this.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to haul my bike. After months of research I ended up with this one. I have had one before but a heavy duty one that was just to heavy for me to lift. This one is a cinch to lift and adjust. Do yourself a favor and order the straps to help hold the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: tech mom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. At first glance they see flimsy compared with similar models of other brands, but they are actually very sturdy. We drove with 2 mountain bikes off road on a very bumpy 4x4 trail, and everything was fine. Next time we go I would add a little more padding where the grips hold the bike bar. I also have a suggestion for improvement for the manufacturer - you should make the hitch connection part such that it can be installed with the bend up or down. On a high vehicle it would be more convenient if the bent was going down rather than up, placing the bike holder lower and closer to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lapidot

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Sturdy, Easy to Load, Not too heavy, but....
customer_reviews.text: Written instructions suck. Grammar is good, but nobody edited or tested it. Fortunately, YouTube videos are helpful and there are lots. I just put it together today and mounted two bikes. I would give it five stars were it not for the difficulties I had putting it together and loading bikes the first time.
customer_reviews.author: :City Slicker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! I think I paid about $70.. but I am a bit worried when I put my $2G bike on it tho.. definitely wobbles and doesn’t fit the large receiver. They just added a spacer but needs to be a bit bigger to be snug. Still worth it for the price. Will probably upgrade soon sometime soon. Easy to take on and off and tighten bikes in. Can be stolen pretty easily tho, but mine hasn’t yet. I use a bike lock to keep it locked with my bike to my receiver if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I installed a front hitch on our 2011 ...
customer_reviews.text: We were not ready to install a hitch on the back of our new fifth wheel so we purchased this. Works great. I installed a front hitch on our 2011 Silverado 3500HD - CURT Front Mount Trailer Hitch Part #: 31023. The bike rack is very sturdy. When loaded with the two bikes it does not impact the viewing out the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sanaker

customer_reviews.title: OOPSI... Lost a Bike!
customer_reviews.text: The rack is stable enough, but the hook that holds the bike on does not lower enough to hold my Giant Liv women's bike. I had bungeed it on the first time I used it and it was fine, but I forgot to use a bungee cord the second time and...oops. Good thing it was on a quiet street and I was going slowly. With the bungee or another type of strap to hold it it's fine, but if you have a women's bike it may be problematic.
customer_reviews.author: christine m.

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful experience with this company
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly had an issue with my Swagman (my fault, not the manufactures). They sent me a replacement part at no cost. What a wonderful experience with this company. And yes....this thing is SUPER easy to use. So much better than taking a tire off everytime I want to go somewhere to fit it in my car. It takes a matter of 1 minute to get it into your tow hitch, and it takes a matter of like 10-15 seconds to put a bicycle up on the rack and secure it. WELL DESIGNED!!! A+++ for my company experience too (thank you so much for the fix on the "shoe").
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value But Flawed
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to mount, assembly not difficult but instructions could be a bit clearer. For the low price hard to beat. My wife particularly likes that it is light weight and she can mount herself. One serious flaw is the bounce or "play" in the carrier over bumpy terrain. I hit a pot-hole coming out of a highway pullout in a state park. The bounce caused one of the bikes to dislodge. Fortunately we had a bungie cord attached to the bike and that stopped it from hitting the pavement. We now always secure the tires with straps to the wheel supports and this appears to have solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: AlanDavis1963

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This works well for RV bumper mount. I used w/Betooll Hitch Receiver Adaptor. Both were easy to install and offered a quick bicycle load and secure transport. I highly recommend both products. This product is listed for use w/cars, but works perfectly for RV and auto design offers additional clearance when humping RR tracks and other ground clearance issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dev

customer_reviews.title: A bargain that works well.
customer_reviews.text: Having used many bike racks, I knew that the bikes I bought would not be held well by a rack that suspended from the frame. The wheel holders and hooks do great job here. Added bungie cords myself, not that they were needed, but it made for a more snug fit. The printed directions leave much to be desired, but the video made it ver easy to install. Yes, the hooks can be a little glitchy, but they work just fine. Time will tell about the durability, but so far I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mooretep

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great bike rack. It does shake a little bit while driving but it’s tolerable. Two regular size mountain bikes fit perfectly on them. I do strap in the wheels for extra safety
customer_reviews.author: S.0

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fast and secure
customer_reviews.text: Given the options for bike carries attached to ahitch, i am very glad I purchased the Swagman. Once I figured out the assembly ( I'm deficient in following directions and all things mechanical), it takes only moments to attatch this carrier to my hithc and only a few moments more to provision the bikes onto the carrier. Since purchasing, I have used the carrier for over 800 miles of hauling and the bikes were completely secure. Price to function (value?) is tremendous. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Spider Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: rugged, holds bikes securely and fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack to replace one that had 'swing out' arms and was a pain to set up. This rack, you adjust the bottom wheel holders to suit your bikes (one time only), then put the bike on and firmly press down on the top bracket. Done! Removing the bikes is just as easy - you just press the ratcheting top hook release (OK, it's a bit stiff but that's why it's so secure) and lift the bike off. Just use a piece of foam rubber to cushion between the top bracket and the bike frame or it will rub the bike paint away.
customer_reviews.author: BBinNOLA

customer_reviews.title: Good price aside, this is an awesome bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Took this out on its maiden voyage today and was very impressed. Actually, forgot the bikes were back there when driving, no rattling around and the backs were held fast. The hook locking mechanism works very well and there is a hole for a padlock to slide through that will secure the hooks in place. It was very easy to set up. Less than an half hour after opening the box, but instructions could be better.
customer_reviews.author: CMcDN

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack to go on my 2013 Toyota Camry. I only haul bikes within a 15-mile radius. This rack is excellent for anyone that doesn't haul a super long distance and removes the rack after every trip. The arms that secure the bike were very sturdy. You can also fully remove them to better adjust positioning of the frame styles you have(slant vs straight). I haul road bikes and cruisers with ease and security.
customer_reviews.author: Linslie

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and great quality. A+
customer_reviews.text: Great value and solid build. We use it with a pair of plus bikes. Specialized Fuse. 3” tires fit perfectly. See pictures. The ratchet feature for both support arms holds your bikes securely and have plenty of padding to protect your frame. Our bikes are 27.5 x 3” 650b mid fat bikes and this rack rocks!!! Our car is 2008 Prius and there is plenty of clearance between bikes-beneath the rack and street and the back of our car. Worth every cent. Road trip ready and easy to install. Very very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: illium13

customer_reviews.title: Good value, poor security
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price, but there are three points of security failure you have to account for, a single padlock won’t work here. Rattles and moves quite a bit but still remains sturdy. Withstood a cross country road trip but will likely be upgrading for something more secure in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Easy to Use Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Excellent carrier!! No sway at all. Sturdy, safe, and very quick and easy to mount and dismount. I did note that security was downgraded because the carrier cannot be locked to the vehicle without purchase of their apx $30 proprietary locking hitch pin. That said, I remove it in less than a minute and toss it into my car for safe keeping. This carrier is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: sem65

customer_reviews.title: Safe, sturdy rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike rack because I was having difficulty lifting my bike into my old rack. This is so much easier. Fairly simple to assemble which I did myself. The security bar locks tightly onto bike frame. I just hauled my bike 50 miles and the rack held my bike in perfect place. I do sometimes have trouble removing bike racks from my car so I have not removed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swagman XC Cross-Country hitch mount bike rack - Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations. Easy to assemble. Secures the bike quickly and tight (I do use an additional tie down for added peace of mind). I can have the rack and bike mounted in under 1 minute. Likewise have everything off in the same time frame. Very nice to load the bike, after a long ride, in seconds and be on my way. Chose this configuration over a frame secured rack because I felt the weight of the bike plus movement/bounce due to road bumps was better transferred to the tire and not the frame. Completely satisfied with this rack and it looks like it is durable enough to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Black

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to. Not loose as ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need it to. Not loose as wobbly as some reviewers experienced. I did use the supplied bolt and lock washer to tighten it to the hitch, and I'm using it in a 1 1/4" receiver, so that may help keep everything tight. I do wish there was a way to tip or swing the bikes out of the way when loaded, but I knew that wasn't an option when ordering this model, so I'm not going to knock the rating.
customer_reviews.author: A Ross

customer_reviews.title: The best bicycle hitch mount
customer_reviews.text: My review of this product is 100%. One the best products I did buy. Easy to build, easy to use, flexible for any bike size. Connecting to 2" or 1 1/4" trailer hitch socket. I have a BMW where I pull a little trailer for a go kart, but can easily transport the bicycles now no hassle. Before this I have used a friend's bicycle mount that need to balance the bike it was a nightmare, this one is just simple the best for any type of bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: cooperSML

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack- good quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I’m a single mom, so being able to easily attach and remove it from the car was important for me. I bought a hitch lock and use a cable lock on the biked when stopping at a restaurant or somewhere. Haven’t noticed any wiggling in the hitch. Feels very secure. My dad has the $400 top of the line bike rack and said mine was good quality, especially for the price. Just less bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: dawn831

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Swagman we've purchased because we love the ease and quality of the product. I have a disability with my shoulders and neck and I can put the rank on my car by myself as well as plaxing my bike on. Placing the bikes in place is easy with the drop down bars. It can be a little difficult to push the button in to lift the bar up, but if you pushthe bike down, the button will release easier. We use the Swagman on our camper (in the back), and in our cars at both of our homes.
customer_reviews.author: Growser

customer_reviews.title: Secure, but ratchet mechanism is tough to work.
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use, especially once you've set it up for your bikes, and I love that it holds them securely rather than letting them flap about like so many hitch-mount racks. Can scuff frame unless you put a bit of foam or something at the contact point. And the biggest issue: those ratcheting mechanisms are finicky and very stiff. I hope they ease up a bit over time, because right now sometimes I wonder if I'm going to be able to get my bike back off the rack once it's clamped down.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great rack for the price. I had to buy a locking hitch pin for the rack and U Lock and cable for my bike. But you can’t beat the price of the rack itself. It’s super easy to assemble and very easy to use. My only complaint is that the ratchet handle to hold the bike in place can get stuck when you are trying to pull it up off the bike. I don’t ratchet down super tight because of that. I already had tire straps from another rack and I use those to strap both tires to the rack. It makes the bike solid on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: andrea blea

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but some missing details...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this unit and have assembled it for use on our motorhome. It appears it will work just fine how I wanted to warn people about a couple things. The piece that goes into your 2" receiver requires a threaded bolt and only a SWAGMAN locking bolt will work. This is due to the treading part. The instructions are not very good and I have a few extra parts with no explanation as to what they are for. The anti-wobble feature is nothing more than the threaded receiver bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger A. Mehrer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t trust with an expensive bike
customer_reviews.text: I used this rack for a while on a 2" hitch on my truck. It is very flimsy and I never had an issue but I always felt insecure about it. Well, after buying a $2000 mountain bike and loading it up, my doubts were confirmed and the bike rolled off the rack on a right turn. There is nothing to secure the wheels to the wheel rings. Ended up doing some cosmetic damage. I highly recommend spending more on a better bike rack. Maybe the xtc2 model with the wheel straps
customer_reviews.author: Ramo

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Economical for Subaru Outback 2016
customer_reviews.text: very useful bike rack for two bikes for Subaru Outback, and easy to assemble. i had some missing lock washers which were easy to replace, Swagman customer support was quick to answer the phone and answered my questions. the tilt version of this rack was much more expensive, and i found out this one is simple enough to keep in place, but with the arms down, the subaru hatch opens and closes fine, so keep that in mind. I need to figure out how best to lock the threaded pin in place so my rack would not get stolen, but that is not a biggie. Good price and well constructed in Taiwan, and highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect bicycle rack!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot overstate how wonderful this bicycle rack is!! It holds two bicycles very securely and it's easy to place the bikes on it. Because your tires are used to mount the bicycles on it, you don't have to worry about your frame being too narrow to fit on the rack. The rack also folds up into a nice compact unit for storage!
customer_reviews.author: firemedic2008

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack does require some set up time to make sure the 2 bikes are positioned properly next to each other. If the user is transporting different bikes all the time the rack will require adjustment to make sure the bikes fit next to each other. The rack is an inexpensive option to transport 2 bikes! Unless the fold down option is bought the bikes must be removed in order to open a hatch on a hatchback car!
customer_reviews.author: CEGLAD

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, well-made.
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient way to mount bikes, and works with almost any frame/wheel combo. I've used it to transport everything from a girl's department store bike to a long travel full suspension enduro bike with good results. My only issue is it sits too close to the car to put on the nearest bike easily - I have to remove the hooks entirely off the top, place the bike in the loops, replace hooks to middle rail. That may be a function of the car though, and if so that's not Swagman's fault. The rack works well, in any event.
customer_reviews.author: trange

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack should work really well for our bikes. One bike is a women's frame which hasn't worked too well on the older style hitch mounted racks. It stores compactly and bikes load quickly and easily. In regard to the questions above, it doesn't come with locking mechanism, just the quick slide clamps. It should be a problem, however, to add locks to it.
customer_reviews.author: JIm D

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great, Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack! I could only find racks similar to this one for $250 to $350 and this one was so much less and just as good! I use some twist ties on the tires and post just because I’m paranoid, but the rack holds the bike securely. I might use a ratchet strap for stability, but might not. Easy to assemble. I don’t like how it secures to my hitch so I’m using a 3/8 bolt and wing nut. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: WAlter Wilson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Glad we made this purchase. Was a little concerned when I saw some of the "1" ratings, but I believe, based on our experience, it was user error. If you follow the instructions and some common sense in loading your bike, there's no way it would fly off. You have to push down on the braces to get the bike cinched down tightly. Ours don't bounce of move. Highly recommend this unit. Great buy for the money and easy to load and unload the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy rack but very poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Without proper instructions I spent over 5 hours assembling this stuff. I was trying to adjust the height of hooks and not able to understand how it moves up I unscrewed the nuts and it took me 2 hours to figure out how the spring was assembled inside looking at the assembly in other hook. If there were clear instructions on how to move the hooks up/down, I wouldnt have gone through this mess:(
customer_reviews.author: pratap

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Strong, Easy to Use, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The Swagman bike rack was easy to install and very easy to use, especially since I carry only one bike. One caution regarding its use with bikes having a sloping top tube: Under heavy bouncing the rear wheel could bounce out of its bracket. I use an adjustable strap under tension from the steering tube to the top clamp to prevent this. Strapping the rear wheel to its bracket would do the same thing. Taking it easy with the bouncing is also a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: J. Milstein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hitch for me.....
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier! Some of the reviews spoke to how heavy it was, I didn't find the case at all. My previous hitch was getting worn out and it was HEAVY. I am 66 and was having problems get the hitch into the mount because it was so heavy. This is much lighter and very sturdy, and was very easy to put together. The instructions are sketchy like all of them but it was easy with just common sense. I would really recommend this hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndel Williams

customer_reviews.title: Less messing around and more biking!
customer_reviews.text: This product has exceeded my expectations. I can put my daughters bike and my bike on in just about one minute. We are driving to our adventure instead of screwing around strapping and securing! Those bikes are not moving until I want them too! Also installation was not difficult. I watched a YouTube video rather than read the instructions because I had read some reviews saying they were complicated. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt M.

customer_reviews.title: Hunk of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty simple and straight forward to assemble and install. I was also initially happy with how quick and easy it wad to load amd un-load my bike... Except the first time I used this, it released my bike while driving to a biking camping trip. Evidently, the clamp had wiggled itself upwards despite seeming so secure. The bike was completely lost. :( IF YOU'RE TRAVELING LONGER DISTANCES, DON'T RELY ON THIS RACK ALONE. THROW IN SOME BUNGEE CORDS.
customer_reviews.author: Imacanoli

customer_reviews.title: a little too flexible
customer_reviews.text: I had my bike come off twice due to the bouncing of the road actually allowing the wheels to come out of the wells. I found that I could just push down on the wells with my foot and get the bike off despite the locking feature, so I have to use a cable lock to secure the bike to the car when I am traveling as the lock does not do that and I have to use bungee cords on the wheels to keep them in the wells during travel.
customer_reviews.author: mark horn

customer_reviews.title: Damaged my Truck
customer_reviews.text: Followed all instructions, mounted two bikes, even put extra bungee cords on and within ten miles a bike came loose and did a couple of hundred dollars of damage to myt truck. Everything was wobbly and shaky. The threaded bolt holding the yoke to the trailer hitch came loose within ten miles.
customer_reviews.author: joseph bambach

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller bike rack for our Prius which came with a 1 1/4 hitch. Fit into the receiver hitch was snug. I sanded the inside of the hitch, added some grease. No wiggles right? I would say the metal is medium duty. Sturdy enough for two bicycles. Good compromise between ease of use and beefy construction.
customer_reviews.author: ooma convert

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: After doing much research I decided on this bike rack and I'm so glad I did! Even my boyfriend complimented me on my wise purchase. We took it on its first outing with 2 bikes on a 300 mile round trip this month and had no problems at all. The install was a breeze and it fits snugly in the hitch with no wobble. The adjustments are easy to make and can accommodate different types and sizes of bikes. The manufacturer obviously took the care needed to make a quality product and secure rack.
customer_reviews.author: PSue

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I used it for short and long trips without any issues. Bike feels secured in the rack. I like to add an extra strap to secure the bike for long trips, but I don't think is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Baeza

customer_reviews.title: Easier than i thought possible.
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. I use it to transport on bike locally. I keep the bike rack on the vehicle the entire season i plan onriding. Only negative is the rack does not lean to be able to open rear of suv. I looked at so many and thought this one did but it does not. Extremely easy to place bike on rack! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty impressive bike rack. I put my large mountain bike on it along with my wife's cruiser with no problems. Just to try it I also put my son's 16" bike on with no problems. It would be nice if it tipped down to get into the back of an SUV. But I knew going in that it wouldn't. The price could be better but I am happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

product_meta.title: Swagman XC2 Hitch Mount Bike Rack
product_meta.description:
ABOUT SWAGMAN

"Ride, paddle, explore: seek your adventure"  That philosophy was the intention of founders Jim and Jan Morris who saw an opportunity to create a better way to transport your bike back in the early 90’s. Swagman was one of the first companies worldwide to design and market a hitch style bike rack. Over the years, that small bike rack company based in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia grew to include numerous other ground breaking designs in the North American Bicycle, RV and Automobile markets. 



AMAZON.COM
The XC Cross-Country 2-Bike Hitch Mount Rack from Swagman is a versatile hitch-mount rack that can easily accommodate children's and adult bikes, downhill bikes, cruiser bikes, full-suspension bikes, BMX bikes, "Y" frame designs, and much more (and without the hassle of removing wheels). The XC slides into a two-inch receiver and carries up to two bikes. 



Swagman's XC Cross-Country 2-Bike Rack easily adjusts to accommodate a wide variety of bike frames. The XC easily adjusts to different bike frame sizes with the simple movement of the wheel hoops. Its frame grip arms feature a soft, frame-friendly coating to protect your bike's finish. When not in use, the rack folds up for easy storage. Specifications:

 * Capacity: Two bikes 
 * Mount: 2-inch hitch 
 * Hitch: Fits Class 3 hitch
feature_bullets: EASY TO ASSEMBLE & USE: Only takes a few minutes to assemble and the upright ratchet arms easily adjusts to different bike frame sizes, will accommodate bike frames up to 59 cm (23.2")
KEEPS YOUR BIKE STABLE: Sturdy design includes a built in anti-wobble hitch device to keep bikes in place
SAVES YOU STORAGE SPACE: Rack folds easily in to compact mode so that you can conveniently store when done using it
VERSATILE: Easily transports up to 2 bikes and is compatible with 1-1/4" and 2" receiver Hitch. Maximum weight capacity is 35Ibs per bike and fits 20" to 29" tire sizes
ACCESSORIES SOLD SEPARATELY: Fat tire wheel trays (64674), 1/2" Locking Hitch Pin (64029) or 1/2" Locking Hitch Pin and Security Cable (64031)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
